text: That morning, when he awoke, Felix looked at his feet, open on the bed, and, already ready to rise, said, “What if I leave the left foot here?” He meditated for a moment. “No, impossible; if you hit the right on the ground, you are sure to hit the left, which is tied. Ea! Let’s test it.” And everything went well. He jumped to his feet, tripped on one leg, while the left leg sat drowsily on the bed. FIN
title: La pierna dormida
author: Enrique Anderson Imbert
